descript.abstract: For a city, street blocks are a very common way in which to organize and relate work (e.g. 'I need to fix a pothole on the 1600 Block of Pennsylvania Ave'). Although driveways or alleys may intersect streets, this representation requires that the segment remain unbroken. Road types include streets. Previously Called Street Segments. Note that there are no from/to address fields. We will not be maintaining them in our data. There also will be no generating a 'streetname' list.For more information please visit DDOT's wiki page.
descript.purpose: This data set was created to act as a basis for public and private institutions to improve their policy and decision making; promote economic development; and enhance the quality of life for residents and businesses.

idinfo.useconst: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

cntorgp.cntorg: Office of the Chief Technology Officer

procstep.procdesc: Staff updated the dataset using the latest information

cntorgp.cntorg: D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer

procstep.procdesc: added buslane_inbound, buslane_outbound, fromstreet, tostreet, ward_id, anc_id, and smd_id fields.
staff added SURFACT_TYPE, PARKINGZONE_RPP, PARKINGZONE_ROP fields.

enttyp.enttypd: Data attributes from DDOT Centerline dataset segmentation.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Unique ID of the route that this segment is on.
The measure along the route that this segment begins (meters).
The measure along the route that this segment ends (meters).
Official name for the roadway segment.
The type of road or path (Street, Alley, Driveway, etc.).
Primary key ID for the block. This is a GUID, which is derived from the BlockID value.
Contains a count of the total number of travel lanes for this segment. This includes turn lanes.
Total parking lanes. **Note: This does not exactly depict the signed parking permissions/restrictions on a block.
Total raised/curb buffers or barriers. **Note: this does not include paint-only buffers.
The sum width (in feet) of the travel lanes on this segment.
Through Lanes + Parking Lanes + Buffer widths + Barrier widths. Represents the paved/roadway Right-of-Way.
The sum width (in feet) of the parking lanes on this segment.
This includes the width of all buffers/barriers.

For more information on how DDOT defines Inbound or Outbound direction, please visit our cross-section documentation (https://wiki.ddot.dc.gov/display/public/GIS/Cross-section+Data#CrosssectionData-Direction).

For more information on how DDOT defines Inbound or Outbound direction, please visit our cross-section documentation (https://wiki.ddot.dc.gov/display/public/GIS/Cross-section+Data#CrosssectionData-Direction).
Roads sometimes are not distinctly marked and have a single (usually very wide) paved lane both directions of travel to use. Alleys typically have this type the most.
Sum of AM/PM rush hour lanes.
This indicates if the roadway is two-way direction or if it only allows one way traffic. If one way, the inbound/outbound direction tells you which direction the traffic flows.
Is Bike lane Adjacent to Parking Lane?
Is Bike lane Adjacent to Travel Lane?
Is Bike lane Adjacent to a “Pocket” turn lane?
A single protected or conventional bike lane; the difference is that the bike lane is going in the opposite direction of traffic.

Painted, on-street dedicated space for biking. Bike lanes are typically 5-feet wide with a bicycle symbol and arrow in the direction of travel. There is no physical separation between the bike lane and the adjacent parking and/or travel lane. They are usually on both sides of a two-way road, and one side on a one-way road.
A pair of lanes for bicycling that are physically separated from automobile parking or traffic with posts, curbs or other type of vertical barrier.
A pair of lanes for bicycling that are painted, on-street dedicated spaces for biking with a simple, painted buffer in between the bike lanes and the adjacent through lane.
A dedicated space for bicycling that is physically separated from automobile parking or traffic with posts, curbs or other type of vertical barrier.
Painted, on-street dedicated space for biking with a simple, painted buffer in between the bike lane and the adjacent through lane.
This indicates if the roadway has an exclusive right turn lane and what side of the centerline it appears on.
This indicates if the roadway has an exclusive right turn lane and what side of the centerline it appears on. **Note: Exclusive left turn lanes are only flagged for one way roads.
Is there a double yellow line on the segment?
Annualized Traffic Volume (Annual Average Daily Traffic).
Year that AADT value was calculated.
Functional Classification codes, using HPMS coded values.
HPMS Sample Section ID #
Type of HPMS sample.
International Roughness Index raw score.
Date of most recent IRI capture.
Internal ID code for NHS Type.
Roadway ownership code.
The generalized PCI condition category for this location (based upon PCI Score).
Date of last inspection for PCI scoring.
The Pavement Condition Index (PCI) score for this location.
The addressing quadrant of DC (NE, NW, SE, SW) in which the segment is located.

Pavement type for the sidewalk at this location. For more information about surface/pavement types, see our DDOT wiki documentation (https://wiki.ddot.dc.gov/display/public/GIS/Pavement+and+Sidewalk+Surface+Section+Types).
The sidewalk width (in feet) at this location.

Pavement type for the sidewalk at this location. For more information about surface/pavement types, see our DDOT wiki documentation (https://wiki.ddot.dc.gov/display/public/GIS/Pavement+and+Sidewalk+Surface+Section+Types).
The sidewalk width (in feet) at this location.

The posted speed limit for both inbound and outbound directions. Generally, these are R2-1 speed limit signs. **Note: DDOT assumes a default speed limit of 20MPH. All directional segments begin with that value until a speed limit sign is detected on the appropriate side.
The posted speed limit for school speed limit sign types.

The posted speed limit for both inbound and outbound directions. Generally, these are R2-1 speed limit signs. **Note: DDOT assumes a default speed limit of 20MPH. All directional segments begin with that value until a speed limit sign is detected on the appropriate side.
The posted speed limit for school speed limit sign types.
Official name for the roadway segment.
The street type/suffix for this street. (e.g. St, Rd, Ln, etc.)
Master Address Repository (MAR) block name.
Master Address Repository (MAR) block ranges. This represents the possible/theoretical address ranges.
Master Address Repository (MAR) block ranges. This represents the possible/theoretical address ranges.
Master Address Repository (MAR) block ranges. This represents the current known/actual address ranges.
Master Address Repository (MAR) block ranges. This represents the current known/actual address ranges.
Master Address Repository (MAR) block ranges. This represents the current known/actual address ranges.
Master Address Repository (MAR) address identifier.
Master Address Repository (MAR) block ranges. This represents the current known/actual address ranges.
Key ID for the block; it is a concatenation of the RouteID, FromIntersectionID and ToIntersectionID.
Functional Classification codes, using DDOT's coded values.
Type of NHS Segment.
Is the segment part of a DDOT Snow Route?
Is the segment part of a DPW Snow Route?
Is the segment part of a DDOT Snow Section?
Is the segment part of a DDOT Snow Zone?
Is the segment part of a DPW Snow Zone?
This indicates if the roadway has an exclusive left turn lane and what side of the centerline it appears on. **Note: Exclusive left turn lanes are only flagged for one way roads.
The length (in feet) of the exclusive left turn lane.
This indicates if the roadway has an exclusive right turn lane and what side of the centerline it appears on.
The length (in feet) of the exclusive right turn lane.

Simple count of the total number of bike lane facilities on this segment.
If there is a conventional bike lane on one side (IB or OB), totalbikelanes = 1
If there are conventional bike lane on both sides (BD), totalbikelanes = 2
If there is a dual protected bike lane on one side (IB or OB), totalbikelanes = 2. This is because, 2 lanes comprise the dual protected bike lane.
If there are dual protected bike lanes on both sides (BD), totalbikelanes = 4. This is because 2 lanes comprise each of the dual protected bike lanes.
The total width in feet of all bike lane facilities on this segment. **Note: excludes any painted or protected buffers.
Indicates if this block has Resident Parking Permitted.
Indicates if this block has Resident Parking Permitted. (original legacy data):
Indicates if this block has been designated as a DDOT Slow Street.
Indicates if this block has dedicated bus lanes in the roadway cross-section.

edom.edomvd: Dedicated Bus Lane in the curblane.
Dedicated Bus Lane in lane adjacent to the curblane (usually a parking lane is the curblane for these cases).
Dedicated Bus Lane in both curblane and next lane over.

attr.attrdef: Indicates if this block has dedicated bus lanes in the roadway cross-section.

edom.edomvd: Dedicated Bus Lane in the curblane.
Dedicated Bus Lane in lane adjacent to the curblane (usually a parking lane is the curblane for these cases).
Dedicated Bus Lane in both curblane and next lane over.

attr.attrdef: Name of streets that intersect the beginning of this segment.
Name of streets that intersect the end of this segment.

Contains text value for DC Ward for the centerpoint of this segment.
- '99' means this falls outside of DC - <Null> indicates a geometry error

Contains text value for DC's ANC for the centerpoint of this segment.
- '99' means this falls outside of DC - <Null> indicates a geometry error

Contains text value for DC SMD for the centerpoint of this segment.
- '99' means this falls outside of DC - <Null> indicates a geometry error
Last time and date the information was updated.
Surface Type

edom.edomvd: Asphalt-Concrete (AC) Overlay over Existing AC Pavement
AC Overlay over Existing Jointed Concrete Pavement
Unbonded Jointed Concrete Overlay on PCC Pavement
Bonded PCC Overlay on PCC Pavement

attr.attrdef: Resident Only Parking (ROP).
Residential Parking Permit (RPP)
Annual Average Daily Traffic for combination trucks.
Year combination trucks volumes collected.
Annual Average Daily Traffic for single-unit trucks and buses.
Year single-unit trucks and buses volumes collected.

These are segments which have one or more Speed Hump or Speed Hump ahead signs present.
Yes = Speed hump signage present on this segment
NULL = no speed hump signage present
Codes are those that are maintained by DC
Codes are those that are used for reporting to FHWA.
